sentences.literal: The Duke of Zhou (Dan) was the younger brother of King Wu of Zhou.

sentences.chinese: 自文王在時，旦為子孝，篤仁，異於群子。
sentences.literal: Even during King Wen's lifetime, Dan was exceptionally filial as a son, sincerely benevolent, and distinguished from his brothers.

sentences.chinese: 及武王即位，旦常輔翼武王，用事居多。
sentences.literal: After King Wu ascended the throne, Dan constantly assisted him and handled most of the affairs of state.

sentences.chinese: 武王九年，東伐至盟津，周公輔行。
sentences.literal: In King Wu's ninth year, during the eastern campaign that reached Mengjin, the Duke of Zhou assisted with the expedition.

sentences.chinese: 十一年，伐紂，至牧野，周公佐武王，作牧誓。
sentences.literal: In the eleventh year, during the attack on Zhou that reached Muye, the Duke of Zhou assisted King Wu and composed the Oath of Mu.
They defeated Yin and entered the Shang palace.

sentences.chinese: 已殺紂，周公把大鉞，召公把小鉞，以夾武王，釁社，告紂之罪于天，及殷民。
sentences.literal: After killing Zhou, the Duke of Zhou held the great axe, Duke Shao held the small axe, flanking King Wu. They smeared blood on the altar and proclaimed Zhou's crimes to heaven and the Yin people.
They released Ji Zi from prison.

sentences.chinese: 封紂子武庚祿父，使管叔、蔡叔傅之，以續殷祀。
sentences.literal: They enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lufu, appointing Guan Shu and Cai Shu to tutor him and continue the Yin sacrifices.
They extensively enfeoffed meritorious officials and same-surname relatives.

sentences.chinese: 封周公旦於少昊之虛曲阜，是為魯公。
sentences.literal: They enfeoffed the Duke of Zhou Dan at Shaohao's ancient site in Qufu, making him Duke of Lu.
The Duke of Zhou declined the enfeoffment and remained to assist King Wu.

sentences.chinese: 武王克殷二年，天下未集，武王有疾，不豫，群臣懼，太公、召公乃繆卜。
sentences.literal: In the second year after King Wu conquered Yin, the world was not yet pacified. King Wu fell ill and was not cheerful. The ministers were fearful, so the Grand Duke and Duke Shao performed false divinations.

sentences.chinese: 周公曰：「未可以戚我先王。」
sentences.literal: The Duke of Zhou said: 'One cannot yet grieve our former kings.'

sentences.chinese: 周公於是乃自以為質，設三壇，周公北面立，戴璧秉圭，告于太王、王季、文王。
sentences.literal: The Duke of Zhou therefore offered himself as pledge, setting up three altars. The Duke of Zhou stood facing north, wearing a jade disk and holding a jade tablet, and informed King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.
